thread.title: Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday after horror head injury leaves him doubtful for Arsenal’s Hull clash
thread.title_full: Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday after horror head injury leaves him doubtful for Arsenal’s Hull clash

author: leeastley
title: Hector Bellerin will not return to training until Friday after horror head injury leaves him doubtful for Arsenal’s Hull clash
text:
Hector Bellerin suffered a concussion after clashing with Chelsea’s Marcos Alonso Marcos Alonso scores for Chelsea against Arsenal but does he foul Bellerin at the same time? 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Arsenal’s medical department will wait for the results before deciding whether he is fit to face Hull on Saturday lunchtime. 
The Spaniard will be kept away from any training sessions involving contact until Friday morning and even if he is kept out of the home game at the Emirates, Bellerin is expected to be ready for the Champions League trip to Bayern Munich tomorrow week. Getty Images Hector Bellerin is awaiting the results of a CT scan after going off injured against Chelsea related stories Team News Arsenal vs Hull: Hector Bellerin a doubt with concussion but Elneny should return after AFCON heartbreak Horror knock Unseen angle shows the terrifying moment Hector Bellerin's eyes roll back into his head after Marcos Alonso's collision in Chelsea defeat 'I'm recovering well at home' Hector Bellerin posts re-assuring update after being knocked-out during Chelsea defeat No risk taken Hector Bellerin 'did not know score' after taking elbow to the face in first Prem game at Stamford Bridge since Ryan Mason fractured skull FIVE THINGS Eden Hazard‘s Maradona moment, Theo Walcott lacks a football brain and Hector Bellerin wasn't fouled Getty Images Hector Bellerin reportedly did not know the score when he came round after being struck Chelsea 3-1 Arsenal : Blues place one hand on Premier League trophy with easy win against Gunners
